intro: Syrianthus grant-duffii, commonly known as the Duffii's Syrianthus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, spiny stems and striking, showy flowers. The plant produces clusters of orange-red, tubular flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
